titleInfo.title: New Mexico Territory, Department of the Missouri (1873)

mods.abstract: Map of New Mexico Territory showing U.S. Army military forts, wagon roads, towns, old Spanish missions and ruins, and territorial borders. It is very detailed in terms of geographic features showing the region's rivers, lakes, mountains and mountain ranges, and unique features such as salt marshes, sand hills, and lava fields.

This map comes from the Buell-Brien Papers, a collection consisting in large part of maps and other papers of Gen. George P. Buell, a U.S. Army engineer who was assigned to the trans-Mississippi West after the Civil War and participated in the Indian wars against the Great Plains tribes. As a Lieutenant-Colonel in the 11th infantry, he led raids against Native American camps in the Red River War, in the Department of Dakota, and supervised the construction of Fort Custer near the battlefield of Little Bighorn, Montana.The original maps in the Buell-Brien collection are a major cartographic resource for the late 19th century West, the U.S. Army's role in the settlement of the territories, and the Great Plains Indian wars.
